page.title: 06ASTON HALL HOSPITAL,ASTON
page.content: ASTON HALL IS A HOSPITAL FOR THE MENTALLY HANDICAPPED,RUN BY SOUTH DERBYSHIRE DISTRICT HEALTH AUTHORITY.THE HOSPITAL DERIVES ITS NAME FROM THE EXISTING HALL BUILT IN EARLY NINETEENTH CENTURY AND HOME OF THE SQUIRES OF ASTON FOR MANY YEARS.CARE FOR THE MENTALLY HANDICAPPED HAS BEEN PROVIDED HERE SINCE l937. IN JUNE l985 THE HOSPITAL HAD l4l FEMALE RESIDENTS AND l65 MALE RESIDENTS. UNDER THR PROPOSED "DERBY SCHEME" FUTURE PLANS FOR THE HOSPITAL AIM TO DISCHARGE RESIDENTS INTO THE LOCAL COMMUNITY. THOSE WHO CANNOT BE DISCHARGED ARE TO BE GRADUALLY RESETTLED ELSEWHERE AND THE HOSPITAL CLOSED BY l995 TO 6. IT IS FELT LOCALLY THAT THIS PLAN IS NOT ENTIRELY FEASIBLE AND THAT MANY OF THE RESIDENTS WILL CONTINUE TO NEED THE SUPPORT OF THE HOSPITAL.
